member.name: IVMRMixerControl.GetAlpha

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetAlpha method retrieves the constant alpha value that is applied to this video stream.

member.param: Pointer to a variable of type float that receives the current alpha value.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an error code.

member.name: IVMRMixerControl.GetBackgroundClr

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
Gets the current background color on the output rectangle.

member.param: Address of a variable that receives the background color.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an error code.

member.name: IVMRMixerControl.GetMixingPrefs

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
Retrieves the mixing preferences for the stream.

member.param: Address of a variable that receives a bitwise OR combination of flags.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an error code.

member.name: IVMRMixerControl.GetOutputRect

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetOutputRect method retrieves the position of this stream's video rectangle within the composition rectangle.

member.param: Pointer to a structure that receives the destination rectangle in composition space.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an error code.

member.name: IVMRMixerControl.GetZOrder

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetZOrder method retrieves this video stream's position in the Z order.

member.param: Pointer to a DWORD that receives the current position in the Z-order.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an error code.

member.name: IVMRMixerControl.SetAlpha

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetAlpha method sets a constant alpha value that is applied to this video stream.

member.param: Specifies the alpha blending value to be applied to all the pixels in this stream.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an error code.

member.name: IVMRMixerControl.SetOutputRect

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. The SetOutputRect method sets the position of this stream within the composition rectangle.

member.param: Pointer to a structure that specifies the position of the rectangle with composition space.

member.name: IVMRMixerControl.SetZOrder

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetZOrder method sets this video stream's position in the Z-order; larger values are further away.

member.param: Double word containing the stream's position within the Z-order.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an error code.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The IVMRMixerControl interface is enables an application to manipulate the incoming video streams on the Video Mixing Renderer Filter 7 (VMR-7). Although this interface is implemented on the filter, it is actually the mixer component that is being configured. For this reason, this interface is only available when the mixer has been loaded through a call to . This interface is intended for use by applications only; it should not be used by upstream filters.
For the VMR-9, use the IVMRMixerControl9 interface.
